text: Mercury poisoning is a health disturbance caused by high levels of exposure to mercury. Symptoms of mercury poisoning include pink colour in the cheeks, fingertips, and toes, swelling, unexplainable sweating, lots of saliva, fast heartbeat (tachycardia), high blood pressure (hypertension) and hair loss for some people. Mercury exposure happens most often through eating certain types of fish or via other ways. ==References== Category:Health problems
title: Mercury poisoning
